channel.title: Please help me!
channel.description:
ok i started by changing all the startup screens and commands and the welcome screen dialogue to my servers name and all that good stuff. when i save it and compile it and restart the server it all still says the name of the old server. but when i go into my client.java all of it says my server name ??? idk whats going on and why it wont work please help me !!!
NOBODY HAS HELPED ME YET !!! :(
here is my compiler code [code]@echo off @TITLE Digital Dogs if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit [/code]

item.title: Please help me!
item.dc:creator: @alpha_0nx alpha 0nx
item.description:
@alpha_0nx wrote:

Odly enough, I also used to have this problem. ;D The way I got it to work is by this:

[ol][li]Redownload the source[/li]
[li]Insert the codes into the correct files.[/li]
[li]SHUT DOWN THE SERVER[/li]
[li]Compile[/li]
[li]Restart[/li][/ol]

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me!
item.dc:creator: @smerf45 smerf45
item.description:
@smerf45 wrote:

ok i started by changing all the startup screens and commands and the welcome screen dialogue to my servers name and all that good stuff. when i save it and compile it and restart the server it all still says the name of the old server. but when i go into my client.java all of it says my server name ??? idk whats going on and why it wont work please help me !!!

NOBODY HAS HELPED ME YET !!!

here is my compiler code

@echo off @TITLE Digital Dogs if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit
